intro: Boerhavia caribaea, commonly known as Caribbean Bladder Camp, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, often in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Its botanical features include a prostrate or ascending growth habit and the ability to thrive in saline environments. Boerhavia caribaea is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
